results.title: Fighting forest fires with power pumps
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Lawrence Cherry
results.brief_description: An instructional film on the use of power pumps in forest fire-fighting. Portable equipment, the operation of a gasoline pump, the efficient deployment of men, precautions in handling hose and equipment, and effective use of varying pressures and volumes of water are demonstrated.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Lawrence Cherry

results.title: Fighting forest fires with hand tools
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Lawrence Cherry
results.brief_description: An instructional film to demonstrate the use of hand tools in fighting a forest fire. The use of walkie-talkie communication is demonstrated. Methods of “back-firing” are described and, after the fire, “mopping-up” to prevent a renewed outbreak.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Lawrence Cherry

results.title: Fighting Arthritis: The Importance of Self Management
results.brief_description: Fighting Arthritis speaks to both the health professional and the lay person. Through the words of people with arthritis, spouses, doctors and health promotion personnel, a dynamic picture emerges of how we can all benefit from the self management approach to arthritis.

results.title: Fight or flight : overcoming panic and agoraphobia
results.creator_credit: Monkey See Productions, Christine Manson and Christopher Thomas
results.brief_description: This video provides helpful advice to sufferers of panic attacks and agoraphobia. We follow two people as they discuss the debilitating effect panic attacks and agoraphobia have had over their lives. They outline symptoms such as feeling that something was physically wrong and the successful techniques they have used to overcome the disorder. The techniques are based on cognitive behavioural therapy, which has proven to be most successful in treating such cases and is taught by Professor Ron Rapee, professor of psychology, Macquarie University, and Dr Lisa Lampe, a consultant psychiatrist who specialises in anxiety disorders. This program is designed for people with panic disorders and agoraphobia, their family and friends and health professionals. It looks at fundamental questions such as what is a panic disorder, what is agoraphobia, what is cognitive behavioural therapy? As well as the role that medication and self help groups can offer to the difficult and often misunderstood condition.

results.title: Fight for the Ashes
results.brief_description: Gives a coverage of the 1953 test cricket series between Australia and England with highlights of play in each match. Concludes with congratulatory speeches by the captains of the opposing teams.

results.title: Fight for life
results.brief_description: Until the 20th century the native farmers of the Gold Coast of Africa were ignorant of the plough and the wheel. Today, their primitive farming methods are being improved through expert instruction, and there are centres where they can learn about dipping, vaccinating, feeding, and improving the quality of their cattle. Commentary by Julian Huxley.

results.title: Fight for country (A)
results.creator_credit: Rockhopper Productions, Bill Runting and Pip Starr
results.brief_description: All the Mirrar are together; we are united against any more uranium mining on Mirrar country…We have no choice - this is our land and our life, we can never leave, we must protect it. Yvonne Margarula, April 2002. Begins with a prologue (12 min.) entitled “An Unparalleled catastrophe” which briefly provides a background of the uranium mining industry, nuclear reactors, and the subsequent environmental disasters and health issues which have resulted world wide, including Chernobyl and its aftermath. The documentary then continues with “Fight for country” which tells the story of the Jabiluka Blockade - a campaign staged in 1998 by both indigenous and white Australians in protest against ERA’s (Energy Resources of Australia now Rio Tinto) recommendation to construct a second mine, Jabiluka, alongside of their Ranger Uranium Mine. Both the Ranger and Jabiluka leases are sited in the Kakadu National Park on Aboriginal sacred land. Over 5000 people from across Australia joined the Blockade and many thousands more participated in protests held throughout the major cities including Melbourne and Sydney. Support came from all walks of life, including Mandawuy Yunupingu of Yothu Yindi, Peter Garrett and Midnight Oil, Kev Carmody, Regurgitator, Coloured Stone, Gary Foley, Sen. Bob Brown, Bono (U2), Australian Conservation Foundation, Friends of the Earth, and most importantly from the Gundjehmi Aboriginal Corporation who provided the legal advice and direction for the Mirrar people in their fight for their rights. Also includes newsreel and archival footage, and backing by some great original music with strong political tones. For more historical background information about the Jabiluka Mine go to www.converge.org.nz/pma/cra0676.htm.

results.title: Fight for a city
results.creator_credit: Belgian Television, Unesco and Manu Simon
results.brief_description: In 1957, Brussels caught the modern fever - it wanted to be like all other big cities in the world. This meant replacing the old city areas with concrete and glass. Many local residents opposed these plans and did not want to be re-housed, so they formed themselves into committees. Following protests from some committees the authorities decided to take a new look at their plans. In 1969 a local committee waged a well-organized combat against an urban policy - it was called The battle for the Marolles and the residents celebrated their victory with a big open-air party. Many other committees were formed after this success.

results.title: Fifty miles from Poona
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Fali Bilimoria
results.brief_description: This film from the heart of India is a story of a rural Hindu family. The film evokes sympathy and understanding for things people everywhere have in common: the love of a farmer for his land, the devotion of a mother to her children. This is the day-to-day life of Vishnu Shevale and his family in the village of Phursangi, fifty miles from Poona.
